intro: Franquevillea major, commonly known as the giant desert lily, is a striking succulent native to South Africa. It features thick, fleshy leaves that store water, adapted to its arid environment. The plant produces large, showy flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming in spring. Its stems are cylindrical and can grow up to several meters in height. Franquevillea major is valued in horticulture for its unique appearance and resilience in dry conditions.
